main event: On 9th October 1955, a sighting of a round, white object the size of a dime with a trail was reported in Barberton, Ohio, lasting four seconds. The object glowed for an estimated one-half mile.
interesting points: The object was described as a round, white object the size of a dime held at arm's length, with a trail extending for an estimated one-half mile behind it.
The sighting lasted for four seconds and the object was observed to be heading south-east.
The report was made by an experienced observer in Barberton, Ohio, despite the presence of ground fog and smoke in the area.
No photographs were included in the report.
The conclusion of the report stated that the sighting was most likely generated by a meteor.
sighted object: round, white object with a trail
